gurmukhi: mihKuAws krKYN ] srMDwr brKYN ] mhodRwid vIrM ] hTy K`g DIrM ]445]
transliteration: Mahikhuaas Karkhain|| Sarandhaar Barkhain|| Mahodraadh Vderan|| Hathe Khagg Dhderan||445||
translation: There was sound of the pulling of bows and the arrows were being showered, the persistent warriors like Mahodar held their swords and stood firmly with forbearance.445.

gurmukhi: Fl h`l suF`lI FolwxM ] rx rMg ABMg klolwxM ]
transliteration: Dhal Hall Sudhallidholaanan|| Ran Ran Abhan Kalolaanan||
translation: The shields sounded like drums and there was being heard the agitated atmosphere of the war;

gurmukhi: BrxMksu n`dM nwPIrM ] brxMksu b`jy m`jIrM ]446]
transliteration: Bharnankas(u) Naddan Naaphderan|| Baranankas(u) Bajje Majjderan||446||
translation: The sound of fifes filled a all the four directions and small cymbals of different colors rang.446.

gurmukhi: BrxMksu ByrI GorwxM ] jx swvx Bwdo morwxM ]
transliteration: Bharanankas(u) Bherighoraanan|| Jan Saavan Bhaado Moraanan||
translation: The kettledrums sounded like the resonance of the group of peacocks on seeing the clouds in the month of Sawan;

gurmukhi: au`ClIey pRKry pwvMgM ] m`cy ju`Jwry joDMgM ]447]
transliteration: Ouchhhaleee Prakdare Paavanadg|| Machche Jujjhdare Jodhanadg||447||
translation: The armoured horse jumped and the warriors were absorbed in war.447.

gurmukhi: isMDurIey suMfI dMqwly ] n`cy p`KrIey mu`Cwly ]
translation: The elephants having trunks and tusks got intoxicated and the warriors of frightful whiskers danced;

gurmukhi: ErVIey srbM sYxwXM ] dyKMq su dyvM gYxwXM ]448]
transliteration: Oradeee Saraban Sainaayan|| Dekhanndsu Devan Gadnaayan||448||
translation: There was movement of all the forces and the gobs saw them from the sky.448.

gurmukhi: J`lY AvJVIXM au`JwVM ] rx auTY bYhYN b`bwVM ]
transliteration: Jhallai Avjhadeeyan Ujjhaadan|| Ran Outhai Baihain Babbaadan||
translation: The blows of very stern warriors are being endured; the fighters are falling in the battlefield and are flowing in the stream of blood;

gurmukhi: GY Gu`my GwXM A`GwXM ] BUA if`gy A`Do A`DwXM ]449]
transliteration: Ghai Ghoumme Ghaayan Agghaayan|| Bhooa Digge Addho Addhaayan||449||
translation: The wounded warriors are wandering circularly and are falling on the earth with downward faces.449.

gurmukhi: irs mMfY CMfY Aau CMfY ] hiT h`sY k`sY ko AMfY ]
transliteration: Ris Mandai Chhandai Au Chhandai|| Hath(i) Hassai Kassai Ko Andai||
translation: In great fury they are killing others and are going on killing; the persistent warriors are tightening their weapons smilingly;

gurmukhi: irs bwhYN gwhYN joDwxM ] rx hohYN johYN kRoDwxM ]450]
transliteration: Ris Baahain Gadhain Jodhaanan|| Ran Rohain Johain Krodhaanan||450||
translation: And being enraged are churning the fighters and are raising the ire of others.450.

gurmukhi: rx g`jY s`jY ssqRwxM ] Dnu krKYN brKYN AsqRwxM ]
transliteration: Ran Gadjai Sajjai Sastraanan|| Dhan(u) Karkhain Barkhain Astraanan||
translation: The warriors bedecked with weapons in the war are thundering and the arrows are being showered by repeatedly pulling their bows.

gurmukhi: dl gwhY bwhY hiQXwrM ] rx ru`JY luMJY lu`JwrM ]451]
transliteration: Dal Gadhai Baahai Hathyaaran|| Ran Rujjhai Lujjhai|| Lujjhaaran||451||
translation: The brave heroes are destroying the forces by striking their weapons and are engaged in continuous fighting.451.
